    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Alien
    Represents an Alien enemy in the game world.
    AlienCharm
    Represents the Alien Charm power-up, a one-time save from being caught.
    AlienController
    The AlienController class manages the behavior of an Alien entity using the LITIengine StateController framework.
    Button
    Represents a generic button prop that can be pressed or released.
    ButtonAnimationController
    Animation controller for Button entities.
    ButtonAttacher
    Utility class responsible for attaching a Button to a given
    invalid reference 
    Prop
    based on its configured name in utiLITI.
    CosmicEscape
    Entry point for the Cosmic Escape game.
    Crystal
    A static crystal prop with no interactive behavior.
    Door
    Represents a radiation-based punishment that uses a shared static countdown timer across all radiation tiles.
    DoorAnimationController
    Animation controller for Door entities.
    DoorButton
    Represents a radiation-based punishment that uses a shared static countdown timer across all radiation tiles.
    Enemy
    Base class for all enemy creatures in the game.
    FollowPathState
    Represents a custom entity state that moves a
    invalid reference 
    Creature
    along a predefined path.
    GameHUD
    Heads-up display component for showing player information such as remaining time and collected crystals.
    GameLogic
    Core game logic handler for Cosmic Escape.
    GameLogic.GameState
    All possible states the game can be in.
    InGameScreen
    The main gameplay screen used to render the world, background, HUD components, and radiation hazard effects.
    Invisibility
    Represents the Invisibility power-up, which makes the player invisible to enemies.
    Jetpack
    Represents the Jetpack power-up, which grants a speed boost.
    LaserButton
    A specialized Button used for laser mechanisms.
    Lasers
    Represents a laser-based punishment hazard that disappears once its associated Button is pressed.
    MainMenuScreen
    Main menu screen containing the title screen, transition animation, scrolling background, logo, and interactive buttons for starting the game or exiting.
    MenuButton
    A scalable animated menu button used on the main menu screen.
    PathMapObjectLoader
    Loads map objects of type "PATH" and constructs an Alien that follows the path defined by the polyline in the map object.
    Player
    Represents the player character controlled by the user.
    PlayerAnimationController
    Animation controller for the Player.
    Powerup
    This is the abstract base class for all power-up items in the game.
    PowerUpType
    Defines the different types of power-ups available in the game.
    Punishment
    Represents a punishable environmental object that updates over time and has an associated PunishmentType.
    PunishmentType
    Enumerates the different types of punishments that can be applied in the game world, such as laser damage, slime effects, or radiation.
    Radiation
    Represents a radiation-based punishment that uses a shared static countdown timer across all radiation tiles.
    Slime
    Represents a radiation-based punishment that uses a shared static countdown timer across all radiation tiles.
    Teleporter
    Represents a teleporter prop in the environment.
    TeleporterAnimationController
    Animation controller for Teleporter entities.
    Timestop
    Represents the Timestop power-up, which freezes all enemies.
    Turret
    The Turret class represents a stationary enemy in the game that can rotate within a limited angle range and detect players using its Vision component.
    Vision
    Represents a radiation-based punishment that uses a shared static countdown timer across all radiation tiles.
    VisionAnimationController
    Animation controller for Vision props.
    VisionAttacher
    Utility class for attaching and synchronizing Vision components with different types of enemies, such as Enemy, Alien, or Turret.
    WinScreen
    Win screen displayed after the player completes the game.
